messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text: Needs a function-level comment, which should mention that the client owns the returned key.

messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text: Why a scoped_ptr when the only possible path through the code is to release() it?

messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text: Why is this comment repeated here and below? Other than versioning prefix, nothing outside of GetEncryptionKey would have to change, right?

messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text: Maybe mention that the only case this should apply to in CC numbers, so we don't need to worry about false-positives?

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Needs a function-level comment, which should mention that the client owns the
> returned key.

Done.

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Why a scoped_ptr when the only possible path through the code is to release()
> it?

This is a defensive coding strategy.  In case new code gets added that returns, we won't leak.

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Why is this comment repeated here and below? Other than versioning prefix,
> nothing outside of GetEncryptionKey would have to change, right?

I left these duplicate comments in for obvious-ness to a new reader who might not notice the comment in GetEncryptionKey().

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Maybe mention that the only case this should apply to in CC numbers, so we don't
> need to worry about false-positives?

Done.

messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text: Isn't this part of your other change?

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Remove this.

Yes, not part of this change.  Will land Mac changes first and then remove this.

The only thing that will change in this file is removal of #ifdefs that are part of the Mac change.

messages.author: dhollowa
messages.text:
On 2010/07/15 18:16:51, stuartmorgan wrote:
> Isn't this part of your other change?

Correct.  Sorry for the confusion.  Most of these changes will get landed in the Mac CL.

messages.author: stuartmorgan
messages.text:

> 
> Correct.  Sorry for the confusion.  Most of these changes will get landed in the
